In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here's how you can implement the function `clean_column` in Julia:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    # Convert to lowercase and remove leading/trailing whitespaces
    col = replace(lowercase(strip(col)), " " => "_")
    
    # Replace hyphens with underscores as well
    return replace(col, "-" => "_")
end
```
This function will take a string (`col`) and convert it to lower case and remove leading/trailing whitespaces. Then it replaces all spaces with underscores using the `replace` function twice: once for spaces and again for hyphens. This way we ensure that there are no spaces or hyphens left in our column name. 

For example, if you call `clean_column("My Column")` the output will be `"my_column"`.
